titleStmt.title: W. Payne et al. to Unknown
CWG9364

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned, residents of Lexington in the neighborhood of John Sheppards Grocery & Provision Establishment respectfully represent that the said Sheppard keeps an orderly, well governed house, that he keeps constantly on hand a large and well assorted stock of groceries and that his establishment instead of being an annoyance to the neighborhood is a source of great convenience.

W Payne
E Montague cap po
G A. Shely
James, M, Graves
W. W Graves
J. Lanckart
J S Masner Po
W J M Chesney
J. R Warwick
Jno G. Shrock
ASA. Collins
T Lindner
H B Boordman
J, Y, Yellman
W L Thwait
T M Bruen
H B uttes
C. J. Gilbert
